Legal_Issue: Whether the designated member erred in granting leave to appeal without following procedural requirements
Governing_Law: Pension Appeals Board Rules, Rule 4; Section 83(3) of the relevant statute
Evidence_Assessment: Skrzypek's application lacked required details under Rule 4; only restated ailments and dissatisfaction
Decision_Outcome: Leave to appeal was granted without required grounds, facts, reasons, or evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to meet Rule 4 requirements for leave to appeal
Legal_Rule: Rule 4 requires applications for leave to include grounds, facts, reasons, and evidence; Section 83(3) requires reasons for refusal but not for grant of leave
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on nature of error
Procedural_Issue: Failure to comply with Rule 4 and absence of reasons for granting leave
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural irregularity in granting leave without compliance with rules
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; case remitted for reconsideration
Decision_Maker: Designated member of the Pension Appeals Board
Review_Standard: Compliance with procedural fairness and statutory rules
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness compromised due to lack of reasons and non-compliance with Rule 4
Key_Evidence_Considered: Skrzypekâ€™s medical conditions and application materials
Legal_Framework: Pension Appeals Board Rules; statutory provisions on appeals
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking disability pension; challenged denial through appeal process
Court_Result: Judicial review granted; matter remitted for reconsideration
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities, as applicable in administrative proceedings
Defendant_Response: Minister initiated judicial review due to procedural irregularities
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, application forms, medical information
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of decision granting leave
Outcome: Case remitted for reconsideration with instructions to either invoke Rule 9 or provide reasons
Remedy_Sought: Set aside decision granting leave and remit for proper consideration
Legal_Provision: Rule 4, Pension Appeals Board Rules; Section 83(3)
Legal_Provision_Cited: Rule 4, Pension Appeals Board Rules; Section 83(3)
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-compliance with procedural rules in granting leave
Applicable_Process: Application for leave to appeal under Pension Appeals Board Rules
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside; remitted for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Rule 4 of the Pension Appeals Board Rules
